intro: Lychnis nemoralis, commonly known as the common mouse-ear. This plant is a herbaceous species native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically found in woodland margins and shaded grasslands. It has small, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are hairy and heart-shaped. The plant grows to a height of about 20-50 cm and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. It is part of the carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
